docs.title: A Guide to Setting Up a Research Environment for Many-Body Computations
docs.text:
This is a step-by-step environment setup guide specially prepared for students who are about to systematically learn numerical computations for quantum many-body systems (though it may also be useful for other fields!). Whether you are using macOS, Windows, Linux, or WSL (Windows Subsystem for Linux), this guide will help you build a complete and efficient research environment from scratch.

We not only cover the core computational toolchain – Python, Julia, Fortran/C/C++, MPI, BLAS/LAPACK (including OpenBLAS/MKL), PETSc/SLEPc – but also carefully include essential daily research tools: cloud storage synchronization, reference management (Zotero), version control (Git), terminal optimization, and more, to make your research work more productive.

All example codes have been tested and are hosted in the GitHub repository guide-env-setup/codes, where you can download and verify them at any time.

Author: Wen Chen · Email: wenchenphy@gmail.com · Version: 3.0.0 (2026-02-14)

docs.title: 多体计算研究环境搭建指南
docs.text:
这是一份专门为即将开始系统学习量子多体系统的数值计算（也许对别的领域也有参考价值！）的同学们准备的手把手环境配置攻略。无论你使用的是macOS、Windows、Linux还是WSL（Windows Subsystem for Linux），本指南都将帮助你从零开始搭建高效、完整的科研环境。

我们不仅覆盖核心计算工具链——Python、Julia、Fortran/C/C++、MPI、BLAS/LAPACK（包括OpenBlas/MKL）、PETSc/SLEPc，还精心整理了科研日常必备工具：网盘同步、文献管理（Zotero）、版本控制（Git）、终端优化等，让你的科研工作事半功倍。

所有示例代码均已通过测试，并托管在 GitHub 仓库 [ guide-env-setup/codes/] 中，你可以随时下载验证或参考。

作者：Wen Chen · 邮箱：wenchenphy@gmail.com · 版本：3.0.0 (2026-02-14)
